p: Projections for T min and T mean were derived from simulations with ten climate model chains according to model ensembles runs conducted for the European Union Framework 6 ENSEMBLES project ( http://www.ensembles-eu.org/) (Table 4). Each model chain consisted of a regional climate model (RCM), driven by a global climate model (GCM), based on the emission scenario A1B (Christensen et al. 2010; Nakicenovic and Swart 2000). The model chains were calibrated with the E-OBS gridded observational dataset with daily data for a 25 × 25 km grid (Haylock et al. 2008; Klein Tank et al. 2009). Using the quantile mapping approach (Themeßl et al. 2010), the calibrated datasets were downscaled and error corrected for different climate stations in the Alpine region within the framework of the EU ACQWA project ( http://www.acqwa.ch) (Haylock et al. 2008; Smith et al. 2014; Wilcke et al. 2013). Covering a timespan from 1951 to 2050, the years 1961 to 2000 served as a calibration and validation period, leaving the years 2001 to 2050 as modelled future data (Mendlik et al. 2011). Data for the periods 1961–1990 (reference) and 2021–2050 (CC scenario) were extracted and used in the analysis.
